title: Save over half off a lifetime Curiosity Stream subscription, now only $179.97
content:
Macworld

With sales for physical media like DVDs and Blu-rays plunging to historic lows, it’s likely you didn’t receive a stack of brand-new movies and TV shows under the tree this year. 

However, in the streaming age, that’s no cause for alarm. Especially because you can still scope up smart, entertaining movies, TV shows, and documentaries to fill all your viewing hours next year and beyond for half the price you’d usually pay.

And trust us – access to a lifetime Curiosity Stream standard membership plan is something you definitely want. Unlike services stacked with mindless reality competitions, pointless sitcoms, and ho-hum dramas, Curiosity Stream offers thousands of hours of documentaries, TV shows, and original programming that explores the depths of human history and its eternal search for knowledge. 

This streaming service was created by John Hendricks, the founder of popular cable channels like Discovery, TLC, Animal Planet, and more, allowing subscribers to watch high-quality shows and movies on all major streaming devices, even in 4K. 

Users can download content to watch offline or even create customized menus based on interests and bookmark shows to watch later. With acclaimed programs like Planet of Treasures, Engineering the Future, and Emmy-winner Stephen Hawking’s Favorite Places, you’ll never scroll for hours through a streaming service desperate for something to watch ever again.

Right now, you can score a lifetime subscription to a Curiosity Stream Standard membership pan at the lowest price you’ll find anywhere on the web, just $179.97.
